title: History of Internet in Bangladesh
description: Explore the key milestones that shaped the evolution of the internet in Bangladesh, from the first email services to the widespread broadband connectivity today.

events.event: First email services introduced via dial-up Bulletin Board Systems (BBS)
events.details: Bangladesh saw the introduction of email services through Bulletin Board Systems (BBS) in 1993, allowing limited offline email transfers via UUCP.
The first commercial internet service was introduced using VSAT technology, enabling direct internet access for businesses and individuals.

events.event: Bangladesh received its own .bd country code domain
events.details: The .bd domain was delegated, allowing organizations and individuals to register local websites.
BDIX was set up to keep domestic internet traffic within Bangladesh, improving speed and reducing bandwidth costs.

events.event: Bangladesh connects to its first submarine cable (SEA-ME-WE 4)
events.details: This was a major milestone, significantly increasing internet bandwidth and reducing dependency on expensive satellite connections.
WiMAX broadband services were introduced, enabling wireless broadband access in urban areas.
The introduction of 3G technology enabled high-speed mobile internet access, boosting digital services and app-based businesses.
A second submarine cable connection was added, increasing the total bandwidth capacity and ensuring redundancy.
With 4G connectivity, users experienced faster mobile internet speeds, enhancing the digital economy.
Teletalk initiated 5G trials in Dhaka, marking the beginning of the next phase of high-speed connectivity in Bangladesh.
